intro: Crossandra infundibuliformis var. coccinea, commonly known as the red flame flower, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It features showy, tubular red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that are typically dark green and glossy, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant blooms. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil and full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in tropical and subtropical regions.
